title: Sensing the environment
description: Animals see the world in different ways. This class will take a look at the different ways animals sense their surroundings via hearing, smell, sight or through touch.

items.content:
At the end of this class you should be able to:

  • Explain what sight is and what eyeshine is.
  • Explain what ultrasound and echolocation is and give two examples of animals that use echolocation.
  • Explain what infrasound is and how elephants use it to communicate.
  • Explain why smell is important to animals.
  • Explain what a territorial scent marker is.

items.caption: Eyesight in different species of animals

prompt.body: According to the video, which of the three animals has the best eyesight?
Which of these animals sees the world in an orange colour?
Which animal can see in two different directions?
Why do animals need senses (zintuigen) such as the eyes, nose or ears to sense their environment?

values.value: Beacuse they need to know if there is food, predators, a mate, danger, other members of it's species etc... around.

content.body: Beacuse they need to know if there is food, predators, a mate, danger, other members of it's species etc... around.

items.content:
Many animals use their eyes to sense their environment. Humans need their eyes the most if they want to know what is going on around them. Birds of prey such as eagles have great eyesight and use it to hunt for prey. Other animals such as cats use sight as well and have a special adaptation (aanpassing) in their eyes which allows them to see in the dark. These cats have a special layer in the back of their eyes which reflects light. Maybe you have seen eyes light up in the dark when you were with the car and the headlights fell on the eyes of an animal.

A lot of animals can't see very well in the dark but cat's do which is why cats hunt during the night as prey is easier to catch.In fact, many predators (roofdieren) have good eyesight. Their eyes can focus on prey right in front of them and see the environment in 3d. This helps them when they want to jump on a prey as they can se how far away the prey is. That is the reason why predators have their eyes in the front of their head.

Prey animals often have their eyes to the side of their head. They can't see 3d and distances but they can see a lot around them making it easier for them to spot a predator.

content.body:
Fill in the correct word, choose from the two options given.

  1. Birds of prey depend on sight/hearing to catch prey.
  2. Cats see more/less sharply than humans during the day.
  3. Because of a special layer in their eye, cats can/can't see in the dark.
  4. You are/a bird of prey is able to read this sentence from 23 metres away.

items.content:
Many animals have very good ears which allow them to hear a predator or prey. They also make sund to communicate with each other.

Elephants use roars and trumpeting to communicate but they can also use infrasound to talk with each other over very long distances. Infrasound is very low sound which humans can't even hear. Because it is so low, it can travel over a great distance and be heard by elephants which are far away from each other.

Bats and dolphins on the other hand use ultrasound to find out where they are or if prey is close by. Ultrasound is extremely high, too high for us to hear. Both of these animals use the ultrasound for echolocation. They can send oud high screeches which bounces off objects or prey. The sound of the screeches bounces back to the animal and based on the loudness of the returned sound, they can decide what the object is and how far away it is.

prompt.body: "Earths largest land animals have a lot to say, even when they don't seem to be making a sound". Explain this sentence.

values.value: Elephants can use infrasound to communicate but we can't hear that.

content.body: Elephants can use infrasound to communicate but we can't hear that.

items.content:
Many animals depend on their nose for survival. They often us it to find prey or sniff out a predator. But they can also use smell as a form of communication. They can smell if another animal of the same species is a male or a female and if she's ready to breed. They can use it to find their way back, like ants do. Animals that are sick will smell differently, telling the other to stay away. Some animals mark their territory using very strong smelling urine or poo. These are called territorial scent markers. Tigers, lions bears and rhinoceros for instance mark their territory with strong smelling urine tellin gothers to stay away.

Skunks (stinkdieren) use smell to chase away predators by spraying them when they get too close.

Many animals including cats have special organs in their paws or allong their cheeks which creates a strong smelling oil. Maybe you have had your cat rub it's head against you when you were stroking it. It actually tells other cats that your belong to your cat. The smell from the oil on you will warn other cats.

prompt.body:
Answer the following goals from this class:

At the end of this class you should be able to:

  • Explain what sight is and what eyeshine is.
  • Explain what ultrasound and echolocation is and give two examples of animals that use echolocation.
  • Explain what infrasound is and how elephants use it to communicate.
  • Explain why smell is important to animals.
  • Explain what a territorial scent marker is.
